result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • David A Robel was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay $1,000.00 fine plus costs and Department of Corrections Supervision fees.   If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
--------------------------------

Not to possess or consume alcohol. Not to possess any controlled substance or drug paraphernalia.
--------------------------------

Must attend Victim Impact Panel within first year of Extended Supervision.
----------
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
----------
Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.
--------------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
--------------------------------

supervisions.notes: Comply with A & R - Intoxicated Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan

11:09 am  Court in session.  Defendant David A Robel in court, in custody with attorney Julia Marie May.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both sides have reviewed PSI, subsequent Addendum to PSI and medical records.
ADA Donohoo believes submission of medical records is a waiver of privilege and wishes to elicit testimony.
11:13 am  Mitzie Cannon, Director of Nursing, Water's Edge Nursing & Rehab, duly sworn and testified on direct of ADA Donohoo.
11:19 am  Cross by Attorney May.
11:22 am  Ms. Cannon excused from subpoena.
11:22 am  Sentencing argument and recommendation by ADA Donohoo.
11:28 am  Sentencing argument and recommendation by Attorney May.
11:39 am  Defendant does not wish to make a statement.  Court will take 5 minute recess.

11:42 am  Back on the record.  
11:42 am  Court having heard testimony, reviewed PSI and subsequent Addendum along with medical records and taking into consideration SM-34 sentencing factors, proceeds to sentencing.

4 years in Wisconsin Prison System, bifurcated as 2 years Initial Confinement followed by 2 years Extended Supervision
338 days dead time credit
Eligible for SAP but Not Eligible for CIP.  Defendant given WEDS form.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:

$1,000 fine and costs including supervision fees
36 month revocation of DL
36 month IID
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge
Must attend Victim Impact Panel within first year of Extended Supervision
A&R
AODA and follow-through
Not to possess or consume alcohol
Not to possess any controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
Counseling as recommended by Agent.

11:56 am  Attorney May moves for medical records to be sealed.  So ordered.
11:58 am  Court in recess.  Minutes filed.

*EXCERPT TRANSCRIPT FILED 9/12/2016 - Court Reporter: Rhonda S. Boss (ko)
**TRANSCRIPT FILED 9/12/2016 - Court Reporter : Rhonda S. Boss (ko)

3:08 pm  Attorney Julia Marie May appeared on behalf of David A. Robel.  David A. Robel not in court.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Assistant Corp Counsel Michael Cotter appeared on behalf of Walworth County.
Defendant did not appear in person today in Racine County but Racine County Court ruled defendant was in custody and transportation must be provided by the County in Racine case.
Court hears from all parties present.
For reasons stated on the record, Court will order transportation order be prepared and County transport defendant for sentencing hearing.
Attorney May notes for the record that oxygen supply will be needed in the courtroom.
3:13 pm  Court in recess.
Minutes filed.

**05/05/2016 - Transcript FILED;  Court Reporter:  Sandra Elderbrook  (df)

Court in session 3:01pm

Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Corporation Counsel Attorney Michael Cotter appeared for Walworth County and Walworth County Sheriffs Department.  Attorney Julia Marie May appeared with co-counsel Attorney Rebecca Hammock. Defendant David A Robel not in court. 

Statement by the Court regarding reason for today's hearing.  
Statement by Atty May regarding other cases and current status here.  
Statement by Atty Donohoo regarding last hearing and bond conditions.  
Atty Donohoo makes statement regarding sentence credit.  
Court questions parties regarding medical furlough.  
Response by Atty Cotter regarding liability and meaning of furlough.  
Court questions parties regarding other types of furlough.  
Response by Atty May.  Atty May makes statment regarding other possible transportation methods.  
Discussion regarding cases pending in Racine County.  
Response by Atty Cotter.  
Discussion between parties.  
Response by Atty Cotter regarding transportation to Racine County hearing on Monday.  
Response by Atty Donohoo regarding preparations if Mr. Robel were to be transported here.  
Court schedules Status Conference for Monday, February 29 @ 3:00pm.
Court resets the Sentencing Hearing for Thursday, March 3 @ 11:00pm.

State did stipulate to sentence credit from March 31, 2015.

Court adjourned 3:37pm
Attorney Julia May
Atty Julia May
